isis.stitle: New Vehicle Loss and Damage Procedures Manual - Delivering Carrier's Unloading Responsibilities

svcproc.title: Delivering Carrier's Unloading Responsibilities
svcproc.para: Listed below are the specific items that have been agreed to as the driver's responsibility to perform when unloading units at destinations. Please refer to the New Vehicle Processing Manual, CTS-1029 and the Warranty Procedures and Administrative Policies Manual, CTS-1100 for complete details.

step1.para: Unload units and remove saddles and wood blocks from the frame.
Reinstall wheels if removed, and tighten the mounting hardware.
Reinstall stacks and antennas. (Canadian delivered vehicles are not responsible for this)
Reinstall Axles. Install new axle gaskets on the rear hubs and tighten in a "star pattern". These gaskets are sent with the vehicles.

note.para: IT IS THE DEALER'S RESPONSIBILITY TO TORQUE THE AXLE SHAFT NUTS AND/OR U-JOINTS TO SPECIFICATION PER PREPARATION AND DELIVERY (P&D) GUIDELINES, NOT THE CARRIER'S. THIS MUST BE DONE BEFORE MOVING THE VEHICLE.

step1.para: Re-install pulled drivelines on decked 4X2 if removed. (SFN 01-32)
Remove all grease from the wheels and rims that resulted from the axle shaft removal.
Unhook the tandems when chained to the frame.
Re-connect and tighten the air brake lines that were removed for transporting.
If spring brakes were manually released, return them to normal working position and install dust caps.
Re-install tail lights in their proper position. Re-connect all wiring, and test for proper operation.
Remove temporary mud flaps, lights, wiring, and air hoses.
If removed, re-install rear spring rebound pins in the proper position.
Re-install all components removed by the Carrier.
Clean up the unloading area; place items in the area designated by the Consignee.

svcproc.para: Keep in mind that the units should be left in the same condition as when received by the carrier from the plant. If not and you have questions, you should contact the carrier before signing the delivery receipt on the ATC Dealer Quality Assurance number at (800) 527-0491.
